Address.college_name: General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1981 as Defence Academy. Acquired university status 1986.
Founded 1992 as affiliated university college. Acquired present status 1995
AdmissionRequirements: GCE Advanced Level, English, Sinhala or Tamil required

Address.college_name: Sri Lanka Institute of Information Technology

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1999. Acquired current status and 2000
AdmissionRequirements: 3 GCE 'A' passes obtained at the same sitting; 3 GCE 'A' level pass in a mathematics stream at the same sitting for Engineering degrees

GeneralInformation.History: Created 2009

Divisions.College: Information Technology, Media and Management Studies

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1921 as Ceylon University College, became University of Ceylon 1942, University of Ceylon, Colombo 1968, and Colombo Campus of University of Sri Lanka 1972. Again became an independent University with present title 1979.
AdmissionRequirements: General Certificate of Education (GCE) Advanced ('A') level in 3 approved subjects with a minimum mark of 40% in the Common General Paper and a higher aggregate mark

GeneralInformation.History: The University of Kelaniya has its origin in the historic Vidyalankara Pirivena, founded in 1875 by Ratmalane Sri Dharmaloka Thero as a center of learning for Buddhist monks. With the establishment of modern universities in Sri Lanka in the 1940s and 1950s, the Vidyalankara Pirivena became the Vidyalankara University in 1959, later the Vidyalankara Campus of the University of Ceylon in 1972, and, ultimately, the University of Kelaniya in 1978
AdmissionRequirements: General Certificate of Education (GCE) Advanced level in 3 approved subjects

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1997 as Buddhasravaka Bhiksu University. Acquired present status and title 2012. A state institution dedicated to Buddhist Monks' education
AdmissionRequirements: GCE A level with 4 or 3 passes and a minimum of 130 marks or equivalent

Address.college_name: Buddhist and Pali University of Sri Lanka

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1982, acquired present status 1997.
AdmissionRequirements: General Certificate of Education (GCE) Advanced ('A') level or recognized equivalent

The university may hold examinations to enable students of any affiliated College in Sri Lanka or abroad, and private students, to obtain its degrees and diplomas (examinations conducted in Sinhala and English)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1981 as Batticaloa University College, acquired present status and title 1986.
AdmissionRequirements: General Certificate of Education (GCE) with Advanced ('A') level in 3 subjects, with a total aggregate of not less than 135 and common general paper with a pass mark of 30%

Divisions.College: Swami Vipulananda Institute of Aesthetic Studies - SVIAS

GeneralInformation.History: Created in 2011 and is the higher education campus of Horizon College of Business and Technology.

Address.Street:
249/1, Malabe Road
Thalangama North
Koswatta, Battaramulla

GeneralInformation.History: Created 2009, first accredited 2015.

Address.college_name: Nagananda International Institute for Buddhist Studies

GeneralInformation.History: Created 2015

Created in 1986 in order to establish a unique institute for capacity building of educational managers, teacher educators and teachers, design and develop school curricula and conduct policy research on education. The NIE is also mandated to advise the Minister on matters related to the development of education in Sri Lanka.

Created 1992 by National Institute of Social Development Act no.41 of 1992 and initially collaborated with University of Colombo. Awarded status of a degree-awarding institution in 2005 by the UGC, and Master's degree awarded from 2008.

Address.college_name: National School of Business Management Limited

GeneralInformation.History: Created 2012

Founded 1980 to enable those of 18 years of age and over to pursue courses mainly in their own time and in their own homes. The multimedia learning system developed by the British Open University has served as a model.
AdmissionRequirements: Three GCE 'A' level passes in relevant subjects may be required for undergraduate entry to Bachelor programmes

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1996.

Address.college_name: South Eastern University of Sri Lanka

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1995. Acquired present status 1996.

Address.college_name: Sri Lanka Institute of Development Administration

GeneralInformation.History: Created in 1982 as a public sector training organization for the development of knowledge and improvement of skills in public administration and management.
Founded 1974 as Jaffna Campus of University of Sri Lanka, acquired present status and title 1979.
AdmissionRequirements: On the basis of the rank order on average 'Z' scores in the General Certificate of Education (Advanced level) (GCE/A/L)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1966 as Ceylon College of Technology, became Katubedda Campus of University of Sri Lanka 1972 and acquired present status and title 1978.
AdmissionRequirements: General Certificate of Education/Advanced Level (GCE/AL) with 3 approved subjects and total aggregates determined by the UGC according to number of places available

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1942, incorporating Ceylon Medical College (1870) and Ceylon University College (1921), and became Peradeniya Campus of University of Sri Lanka 1972. Acquired present status and title 1978.
AdmissionRequirements: General Certificate of Education (GCE) with Advanced ('A') level in 4 approved subjects

Divisions.College: Postgraduate Institute of Humanities and Social Sciences

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1978 as Campus of University of Sri Lanka, and reconstituted as Ruhuna University College 1979. Acquired present title 1984.
AdmissionRequirements: General Certificate of Education (GCE) Advanced ('A') level in either 4 approved subjects, or 3 approved subjects and a mark of not less than 25%

Divisions.College: Fisheries and Marine Science and Technology

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1959 as Vidyodaya University. Became Campus University of the single University of Sri Lanka 1972.
AdmissionRequirements: General Certificate of Education with Advanced ('A') level in 4 approved subjects, or equivalent foreign qualification

Address.college_name: University of the Visual and Performing Arts

GeneralInformation.History: Created 1953 as Government College of Fine Arts. Became Institute of Aesthetic Studies in 1973. Acquired current title and status 2005.
Founded 2005.
Founded 1999, acquired present status and title 2000.
